section.title: Overview
section.para: This module contains REGISTER processing logic for the S-CSCF. The 'storage engine' of this module is provided by the ims_usrloc_scscf module:

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
CDP
CDP_AVP
TM
ims_usrloc_scscf

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
LibXML2 - used for parsing the XML Subscription information obtained from the HSS (Home Subscriber Server)

section.title: default_expires (int)
section.para: If the processed message contains neither Expires HFs nor expires contact parameters, this value will be used for newly created S-CSCF usrloc records. The parameter contains number of second to expire (for example use 3600 for one hour). If it is set to a lower value than the min_expires parameter then it will be ignored. This parameter can be modified via ser config framework. A random value in a specific interval can be selected by using the default_expires_range parameter

section.title: default_expires_range (int)
section.para: This parameter specifies that the expiry used for newly created S-CSCF usrloc records are not fixed(when default_expires applies), but a random value in the intervalrdq [default_expires-default_expires_range%, default_expires+default_expires_range%]. The value is between 0 and 100 and represent the maximim percentage from default_expires that will be substracted or added when computing the value. Default in 0, meaning default_expires is left unmodified. This parameter can be modified via ser config framework.

section.title: min_expires (int)
section.para: The minimum expires value of a Contact, values lower than this minimum will be automatically set to the minimum. Value 0 disables the checking. This parameter can be modified via ser config framework.

section.title: max_expires (int)
section.para: The maximum expires value of a Contact, values higher than this maximum will be automatically set to the maximum. Value 0 disables the checking. This parameter can be modified via ser config framework.

section.title: subscription_default_expires (int)
section.para: If the processed message contains neither Expires HFs nor expires contact parameters, this value will be used for newly created subscriptions. The parameter contains number of second to expire (for example use 3600 for one hour). If it is set to a lower value than the subscription_min_expires parameter then it will be ignored. A random value in a specific interval can be selected by using the subscription_expires_range parameter

section.title: subscription_expires_range (int)
section.para: This parameter specifies that the expiry used for newly created subscriptions are not fixed(when subscription_default_expires applies), but a random value in the interval [subscription_default_expires-subscription_expires_range%, subscription_default_expires+subscription_expires_range%]. The value is between 0 and 100 and represent the maximim percentage from subscription_default_expires that will be substracted or added when computing the value. Default in 0, meaning subscription_default_expires is left unmodified.

section.title: subscription_min_expires (int)
section.para: The minimum expires value of a subscription, values lower than this minimum will be automatically set to the minimum. Value 0 disables the checking.

section.title: subscription_max_expires (int)
section.para: The maximum expires value of a subscription, values higher than this maximum will be automatically set to the maximum. Value 0 disables the checking.

section.title: user_data_dtd (string)
section.para: DTD to check the user data received in SAA (Server Assignment Answer).

section.title: user_data_xsd (string)
section.para: XSD to check the user data received in SAA (Server Assignment Answer).

section.title: support_wildcardPSI (int)
section.para: indicate support for wildcard PSI is subscription profile (SAA)

section.title: scscf_name (string)
section.para: The name of the S-CSCF

section.title: store_profile_dereg (int)
section.para: Should the subscription profile be stored on de-registration

section.title: cxdx_dest_realm (string)
section.para: Destination realm to be used in Diameter messages

section.title: cxdx_forced_peer (string)
section.para: FQDN of Diameter Peer (HSS) to use for communication (SAR). If you use this, the routing defined in your diameter xml configuration file (CDP) will be ignored and as a result you will lose the benefits of load balancing and failover.

section.title: append_branches (integer)
section.para: The parameter controls how lookup function processes multiple contacts. If there are multiple contacts for the given username in usrloc and this parameter is set to 1, Request-URI will be overwritten with the highest-q rated contact and the rest will be appended to sip_msg structure and can be later used by tm for forking. If the parameter is set to 0, only Request-URI will be overwritten with the highest-q rated contact and the rest will be left unprocessed. This parameter can be modified via Kamailio config framework.

section.title: method_filtering (integer)
section.para: Tells if the contact filtering based on supported methods should be performed during lookup. It's enabled only if it has a non zero value.

section.title: user_data_always (integer)
section.para: If specified this will make the S-CSCF always request user data from HSS.

The function processes a REGISTER message. It can add, remove or modify usrloc records depending on Contact and Expires HFs in the REGISTER message. On success and when called from the REQUEST_ROUTE, 200 OK will be returned listing all contacts that are currently in usrloc. On an error, error message will be sent with a short description in reason phrase. In case of internal errors the function will return FALSE, otherwise a force to exit the cfg is file is actioned by returning 0 (asynchronous processing)
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: async_reply_route- the route to execute after the save has completed. This is required because the save function is executed asynchronously (Diameter).
domain- Logical domain within registrar.

section.para: This function can be used from REQUEST_ROUTE, ONREPLY_ROUTE

This function extract the IMPU from the Request-URI and tries to find all registered contacts in usrloc. If there are no such contacts, -1 is returned. If there are, Request-URI will be rewritten with the contact that has the highest q value. The rest of the contacts will be appended to the sip msg structure (if append_branches is set) and can be later used by TM module for forking for example...
If the method filtering option is enabled, the lookup function will only return contacts that support the method of the request being processed (see allows header)
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: domain - Logical domain within registrar.

section.para: Return codes:

listitem.para: -1 - Not found
-2 - Found, but method not allowed (check Allows header for INVITE, MESSAGE, etc).
-3 - Error ocurred internally during processing

section.para: This function can be used from REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE

example.title: lookup usage

section.para: This function take a URI and tries to find the contact in usrloc. If the contact is found and has a path set, then a path header is added to the SIP message so it can be loose routed.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: uri - URI of contact to lookup

section.para: Return codes:

listitem.para: 1 - Success
-1 - Failure

section.para: This function can be used from REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE
This function will remove all bindings for the IMPU found in the Request-URI.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: Domain- Logical domain within registrar.

section.para: This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE
TBD
used in REQUEST_ROUTE
This function checks if the IMPU in the To header is registered in usrloc.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: domain- Logical domain within registrar.

section.para: Return codes:

listitem.para: 1 - True, IMPU exists in registered state in usrloc

section.para: This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE

example.title: impu_registered usage

section.para: This function checks if the IMPU in the Request-URI is registered in usrloc.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: domain- Logical domain within registrar.

section.para: Return codes:

listitem.para: 1 - True, IMPU exists in registered state in usrloc

section.para: This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE

example.title: term_impu_registered usage

section.para: The function fetches the contacts for 'uri' from table 'domain' to pseudo-variable $imssulc(profile) [imssulc = ims scscf ulc].
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: domain - Name of table that should be used for the lookup of contact addresses.
uri - The SIP URI address of the user which to fetch the contact addresses for. It can contain pseudo-variables that are evaluated at runtime.
profile - Name of $imssulc pseudo-variable profile that will store the fetched contacts. It is a static string.

section.para: This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE

The function frees the contacts from pseudo-variable $ulc(profile). Should be called to release the content of a profile. Anyhow, fetching a new contact addresses set over a profile will release any existing data in that profile.
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:

listitem.para: profile - Name of $imssulc pseudo-variable profile that stores the contacts. It is a static string.

section.para: This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE, FAILURE_ROUTE
This function checks to see that a SUBSCRIBE request is authorised to subscribe to the particular identity. Only 3 entities can subscribe:

para.emphasis: The user agent to it's own state

listitem.para: The P-CSCF specified in the path header for that user
Application Server (AS) not yet implemented

section.para: Meaning of the parameters is as follows:
This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE
Save the subscription to the REG event for the UAC or the appropriate P-CSCF (in the path to the UAC).
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:
This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE
This function checks to see that a PUBLISH request is authorised to publish for a particular identity. Only 3 entities can publish:

para.emphasis: The user agent to it's own state

listitem.para: The P-CSCF specified in the path header for that user
Application Server (AS) not yet implemented

section.para: Meaning of the parameters is as follows:
This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE
Save the publish to the REG event for the UAC or the appropriate P-CSCF (in the path to the UAC).
Meaning of the parameters is as follows:
This function can be used in REQUEST_ROUTE

section.title: RPC Commands
section.para: exported RPC commands.

section.title: ulpcscf.status
section.para: Status of pcscf_usrloc, AORs, max slots, etc.

section.title: Statistics
section.para: Exported statistics are listed in the next sections.

section.title: registered contacts
section.para: Number of AOR contacts in registered state - cannot be reset.

section.title: impus
section.para: Number of IMPUs - cannot be reset.

section.title: expired contacts
section.para: Number of expired contacts - can be reset.
